comments.content:
I don't know if this problem is only mine,   
but every time i try to post i receive   
the message "internal server error" and   
the warning that my post wasn't sent   
(while actually it has been sent).

I like 002.   
   
And I get those server errors every single time I post.

A shirt _can_ have very small text/elements, but then it also needs a larger "view" to draw people in. To me just a bit of small text with nothing else is too terminally hip - it'll end up wilting anemic on Hollywood boulevard.   
   
hhp

25.009, es muy buena, algo como el arte de kraftwerk, buena polera!.   
   
25.004 no es lo que uno se espera, pero tiene un gustito, algo transgresor, que es bueno encontrar siempre. de quien sea, un buen gesto.
Jko entiento nada! should i response in greek (since i am greek)?
There's something about 006 I just love. I have to agree with Yves' statement about people having to get a little _too_ close to read it, though.

Yep, it happens once in a while when Typophile gets   
buggy. Nothing serious though, it's just a bit confusing.   
   
I second your opinion about 25.006, but I'm worried   
that those kind of designs are too detailed for a T-shirt:   
people would need to get far too close for comfort to   
be able to decipher the text, and they don't make that   
much sense when seen from afar.   
Not every brilliant idea translates well to a T-shirt.

Again, how close do you need to get to be able to   
decipher the text? That's a big question mark for me.

These nifty ones must've fallen between the keys. Our apologies.
